file_content.text: It's a wonder all your men survived such an enemy. How did you defeat the Gen'Dai?
Superior tactics--and a dozen thermal detonators. If those Gen'Dai are still alive, I guarantee they wish they weren't.
We couldn't have done this without you and your men.
Nice work, Sergeant.
You didn't make certain the Gen'Dai were finished before you left? What if they come back?
You're not sure they're dead?
I'll use two dozen thermal detonators.
Those explosives could've collapsed the dreadnaught on top of us.
That was reckless.
I'd never jeopardize your mission. Only my part of the ship was at risk.
Your service has been exemplary, Sergeant. You and your men brought the Republic a great victory.
I'm sorry to hear about your men, Sergeant. The Jedi Order will remember them as heroes.
Their actions today will bring lasting peace--and their names will live on forever.
So will the galaxy.
You're the only one who made it back?
You lost everyone?
No Imperials survived, I can promise you that.
We'll destroy a hundred Sith for every soldier we lost.
The Empire will pay for this.
Yes, Master Jedi. Victory or death.
We must honor the fallen by ending this war quickly. I won't let their sacrifice be for nothing.
Sergeant Rusk... and my cooperative Jedi friend. We finally meet in person.
The heroes of Hoth. I finally get to meet you in person.
General Grayne. Been a while.
Hard to believe you and I started in the same squad. Still a ground-pounder, hmm?
Wouldn't have it any other way. It's honest work, sir.
After what he did here, he's earned a higher rank.
Rusk deserves a promotion.
The sergeant's happy where he is--but I do have a reward in mind.
I didn't realize you and the general were comrades.
You know each other?
We had some short-lived adventures, back during the war.
You can hardly tell that left leg isn't real, sir. The medtechs did good work.
Enjoy catching up, you two. We're needed elsewhere.
Let's go, Leeha.
A moment, please. I have something for you.
The 88th Armor battalion is on its way. The 301st Infantry is being rotated back to Coruscant.
I can't waste a soldier like Rusk on shore leave, so I'm assigning him to you.
For how long, sir?
Until the Sith Empire is defeated.
The sergeant has served us well. We'll gladly take him.
Sounds good to us.
I'm not sure what further need we'll have of him, but he's welcome to join us.
If you insist.
If nothing else, he can guard your ship.
The Empire's defeat is sooner than you think. We won't need him.
No thanks--you keep him.
This assignment comes from General Durant. You remember him don't you, Rusk?
We survived the Geonosis campaign together.
That's one way of putting it.
The transfer is effective immediately. Good luck.
My shuttle is small. There's hardly enough room for myself and the Meedees. Perhaps Sergeant Rusk should travel with you?
Be honored to. Look forward to learning from a superior warrior.
Excellent. I will deliver these technical readouts to Master Braga. You should contact him, as well. May the Force be with you, my friends....
I did it! I secured the technical readouts of the Emperor's fortress. They contain schematics of its entire defense grid.
Between this and the cloaking device prototype you recovered on Balmorra, we have everything we need to capture the Emperor.
We still need a way to pierce that cloaking device surrounding his fortress, but we're closer now. I feel it.
This is a great day for the Jedi Order. Good work, Leeha.
The Force is with us.
Heard anything from Rusk? How did his squad make out?
What about the sergeant?
Everyone's alive and in one piece. Looks like we won the day.
The sergeant is alive. The rest of his squad... I'm not sure.
I'm not injured or dead, thanks for noticing.
Show some concern for me.
I assumed you'd be fine. You always are.
Meet me at the main Republic base. Leeha Narezz out....
I'll make sure Sergeant Rusk has a full squad backing him up. Don't wait for us. Head for the dreadnaught.
I'll be ready to move as soon as you and Sergeant Rusk engage the enemy forces.
Unfortunately, that area lies directly between two large forces: White Maw pirates and Imperial strike teams. They're battling for control.
We can't let either side win. We'll have to defeat them both.
We'll take them both on.
Which side has the advantage, the pirates or the Imperials?
Is one side winning?
They're at a stalemate. The Imperials have superior heavy weapons, but the pirates are... unnaturally resilient.
Scans indicate the pirate leaders are an alien species known as Gen'Dai. Virtually impossible to kill.
Sounds like a challenge.
We'll just sit back and let our enemies wipe each other out.
Let them destroy each other.
My fear is that one side will steal what we need and then retreat. We can't allow that.
I will secure the technical readouts if you and Sergeant Rusk keep those forces occupied. Which enemy would you prefer to face?
I'll be fine either way. How can we minimize casualties to your squad, Sergeant?
Ask Sergeant Rusk.
The pirates lack discipline. They'll panic under pressure, make mistakes.
That leaves the Imperials for you. Perhaps you can learn more about the Emperor's personal guard.
That leaves you the Imperials. Let's hope their talk about being Jedi-killers was false bravado.
Those troops are the Emperor's personal guards. I'd like to know why they're here.
The Imperials.
As do I. Their presence here is disturbing.
I think those "Jedi-killers" the Empire sent should be dealt with.
The Imperials.
I doubt they're prepared to kill a Jedi like you.
Leave the White Maw pirates to me. I'll make sure they don't bother you.
I want to teach the White Maw a lesson it'll never forget.
The pirates.
Then Sergeant Rusk will head off the Imperials.
Here are the coordinates to intercept the enemy forces. Once you engage them, I'll retrieve the technical readouts.
Sergeant, let's get you some reinforcements. Perhaps I should do the talking?
If you insist, Master Jedi.
Be careful facing the Imperials, my friend. May the Force be with us.
Be careful with those pirates, my friend. May the Force be with us.
The Meedees report the pirates' ray shields are down. Our goal is within reach.
Glad to see everyone made it back. Are your men ready, Sergeant?
Squad strength sixty-six point four percent, Master Jedi. Enough to finish the job.
Squad strength one hundred percent, Master Jedi. Ready to finish the job.
Thanks for talking him out of that munitions dump nonsense. Saved us a world of trouble.
Our mission is more important than destroying the White Maw.
We have larger concerns.
I won't throw you men at non-essential mission objectives.
It was a waste of time.
Wish the sergeant felt that way....
Any sign of Sergeant Rusk or his men? I expected them back by now.
Some general ordered Rusk's men to hit the pirates' weapon supply depots.
They're on a mission.
I hope the soldiers are alright. Between you and me, I think the sergeant pushes his men too hard.
We were hitting the White Maw's weapon supply depots. I suspect they'll arrive any moment.
They should be here.
I worry we ask too much of them. Sergeant Rusk has lost many soldiers.
I worry we ask too much of them. The men serving with Sergeant Rusk seem unhappy.
Met guys like Rusk on Balmorra. Strangely enough, they always wind up victims of friendly fire....
I'm sure they'll arrive shortly. If not, we do this without them.
Give the men time.
I'm not certain that's possible, if the Meedees' scouting data is accurate....
I'm more than a match for those pirates, with or without soldiers.
You don't need them.
Unfortunately, pirates aren't our only concern....
Sorry to keep you waiting. We sustained heavy losses achieving our objectives.
Squad strength is thirty-three point two percent, but we'll make do. What's the next mission?
I'm not going anywhere. Following you maniacs will just get me killed!
My squad-mates survived two years of fighting on Ord Mantell. One day serving you wiped us out!
Saving the galaxy requires sacrifice. We're all expendable to the mission, soldier.
The first duty of a Jedi is to protect life--especially the lives of those who risk everything for us.
That isn't true.
The fatality rate in your squad seems high. Maybe we should exercise greater caution.
Within reason.
Hesitation loses battles. So does insubordination.
You can serve us or face the consequences.
Exactly right, Private.
Go ahead--throw me in the brig. At least I'll be safe!
The private clearly needs medical attention. We can't send him back out like this.
I'll find volunteers from this outpost to complete our mission and restore your squad to full strength.
You're dismissed to the medcenter, Private.
Master Jedi... destroying the pirates' weapon depots took longer than expected, but the mission was a complete success.
Squad strength remains at sixty-six point four percent.
Squad strength remains at one hundred percent.
We've got you to thank for that. If we'd had to go it alone....
Always happy to lend a hand, Private.
My pleasure.
I'm sure your squad would've achieved the objective without me.
You could've handled it.
Sure, but how many of us would be alive?
Private Dromol--get back in formation.
You forget yourself. Back in formation.
Shut your mouth, Private.
That's enough, Private. You angling for a demotion?
There is no rank below private, sir.
Try me, soldier.
This is a full scan of the dreadnaught. The technical readouts are currently under minimal guard.
Shut down that reactor and meet me at the Republic forward base. I'll find the path to our objective.
Coordinate with Sergeant Rusk. I need a moment.
Impatience got the better of me. I blundered in here like a Padawan. The heavy turrets were an unpleasant surprise.
You know how many patients I've treated for heavy turret wounds? Zero. You're one in a billion, lady.
All those turrets--just for us? I'm touched.
Imperial blaster turrets = high rate of fire // T7 = advises caution
You were surrendering, Jedi. I suggest you keep that promise.
Give us a moment, please. I need to explain the situation to my friend.
I obviously missed a lot. Give me the short version.
Please do.
I sprung a trap. The end.
You've been shot. Is it bad?
You're wounded.
I'll survive--for now.
I don't see that many Imperials. Whatever I don't kill is yours.
Let's kill them all.
Wait a few moments. It'll be worth it.
Turns out, the Imperial on the holo is more interested in capturing than killing us. Keep him talking. Trust me.
My patience is at an end. Lay down your weapons or my men will destroy you.
Tell your men to disarm and let's talk. I'm sure we can come to an agreement.
Let's settle this peacefully.
There will be no compromise. You will surrender, or die.
Those uniforms... you people aren't standard Imperial military.
Who are you?
I am a member of the Emperor's personal guard--as are the men under my command.
A bunch of Imperial lackeys versus two Jedi? I almost feel sorry for you.
Good luck with that.
Your friend did not fare well against my "lackeys." Neither will you.
The soldiers you face are specially trained to kill Jedi--and they outnumber you.
Not anymore, Imperial scum.
They tricked us! Kill everyone!
Imperial forces are excavating the wreck at an ice cavern nearby. We need to move fast--and we'll need reinforcements.
Tell our backup he needs to pull that new squad together yesterday.
Call Sergeant Rusk.
What are the odds this is the same vessel we're looking for?
You're sure about this?
The level of effort the enemy's putting into that excavation can't be a coincidence.
Don't bother. Reinforcements will just get in my way.
I'll handle this alone.
We have to approach this carefully. There could be a battalion of Imperials in the cavern.
I'll contact Sergeant Rusk and inform him of the situation. You and I will hit the enemy from two directions.
I'll enter the cavern at these coordinates. You go in at this entrance. We'll meet in the middle.
[ME-D1 whistles worriedly.]
Don't worry, Meedee. The Force is with us. I'll see you at the cavern.
I have the Imperial survey maps of the starship graveyard.
I understand Sergeant Rusk's squad paid dearly for these.
Meedee-one, please analyze the maps. Find any profile that matches a Pythar-class Imperial shuttlecraft.
[The little droids beep excitedly.]
The Meedees are pleased to meet you. They're great fans of yours.
Hello there, my little friends.
Nice to meet you all.
I prefer admirers with a pulse, myself.
Aw, you've got your own booster club. Good for you.
Scanning "Meedee" units = complete // No threats detected = Jedi safe
I didn't realize I'd become a droid celebrity.
They know me?
Maybe that's why those probe droids kept rushing at you.
Everyone's famous to somebody.
Jedi = always a celebrity to T7
I'm not here to sign autographs for droids.
I don't have time for this.
Fame's already gone to your head, huh?
At least let them record a few holos.
Jedi = on important business // "Meedee" units = back off
Ever since I built the Meedees, I've been teaching them Jedi history, philosophy--everything.
Someday, the Meedees will prove that even droids can use the Force.
The Force is generated by living beings, not machines.
That seems unlikely.
How do you define a living being? In the end, aren't we all just machines of a sort?
If a droid became Force sensitive, that would be extraordinary.
What a fascinating idea.
The Council doesn't believe me, but I think it's already happened more than once.
Throughout history, certain droids have achieved well beyond their design limitations. I believe the Force is the answer.
T7 = completed Tython trials with Jedi // T7 = receive lightsaber upgrade?
Droids who go long enough without memory wipes develop personalities. Couldn't they develop more than that?
I think you're jumping to conclusions, but good luck with your experiment.
I'm not convinced.
Even Master Braga is skeptical. But one day, the Meedees will prove me right.
I think you're onto something, Leeha.
Absolutely they could.
You're the first member of our order to admit the potential. Even Master Braga is skeptical.
Having a personality subroutine isn't a connection to the Force.
Not a chance.
Unless it relates to our mission, assume I don't care.
None of this interests me.
I think you hurt the Meedee's feelings.
[ME-D1 beeps and whistles with alarm.]
You found something? Let me see... hmm... the Empire recently discovered a crash site matching the scientist's vessel.
Sorry I couldn't meet you. We've got a full-scale Imperial invasion on our hands. They caught us by surprise.
Tell me your position. I'll come to you.
I'm on my way.
How bad is it out there? Have you been injured?
Are you safe?
Don't worry about me--but we've taken hundreds of casualties since the attacks began.
We knew the Empire was here. How could they possibly surprise us?
We must be idiots.
Until now, the Empire's been more interested in the White Maw pirates than us.
I'm defending a forward outpost, but our support team is pinned down closer to you. I'm sending the coordinates now....
You're looking for a detachment from the 301st Infantry, led by Sergeant Rusk. His squad is being overrun by Imperial probe droids.
I'll find your friends. A few probe droids shouldn't pose much of a threat.
Consider them rescued.
Master Braga said no one knows about our strike team. How did Republic soldiers get involved?
Our mission isn't top secret?
They don't know the details of our mission--only that we're trying to save the galaxy.
Those soldiers are in terrible danger. The probe droids are making suicide runs, exploding when they get close.
Those soldiers are in terrible danger. The probe droids have been programmed to make suicide runs.
If those soldiers are any good, a few probe droids shouldn't be a problem.
They can handle themselves.
These droids are set to rush targets and explode when they get close enough.
Saw things like that on Balmorra. They can make a real mess.
Have to hand it to the Empire. When it comes to killing people, they're innovators.
Empire = no regard for droid existence // T7 = disgusted!
Sergeant Rusk has vital information we need. I'm counting on you to keep him and his men alive. May the Force be with you.
These probe droids are programmed to make suicide runs on their targets.
This is Jedi Knight Leeha Narezz. Please identify.
Master Tol Braga sent me to help you.
I already received word of your success on Balmorra. Glad you're here.
Your reputation precedes you. Glad you got here so quickly.
As if Hoth wasn't hostile enough, I'm contending with the Empire and White Maw pirates, of all things.
What could pirates and Imperials possibly want here?
That's a lot of opposition.
Why can't I land on the planet? What's so dangerous about it?
What's so hostile about Hoth?
Hoth's daytime temperatures freeze most vehicle engines. After dark, anything alive caught outdoors doesn't last long.
I'll keep you warm. My natural body temperature runs high--and I am a doctor.
That's generous, Doc, but a little cold won't bother me.
Thanks, but I'll be fine.
The offer stands. Your warmth is my priority.
If I get chilly, you'll be the first to know.
[Flirt] I'll remember that.
This bridge feels warmer already....
If I need medical attention, I'll find a droid.
Don't flatter yourself.
Pssh. Droids? No bedside manner.
Stay close to me, Kira. I'll keep you from freezing.
You and what army?
I'm getting a lot of interference on this end. What's the problem?
Your signal is breaking up.
The planet's atmosphere plays havoc with comm frequencies. We're lucky to have any signal at all.
Hoth's one of the largest starship graveyards in the galaxy. During the war, there was a massive battle in orbit.
Dozens of vessels crashed to the surface. Because of the freezing cold, they've remained well-preserved. Some are almost intact.
Our objective's in that starship graveyard, isn't it?
You're hunting for something.
I imagine the White Maw came here to loot the remains.
That explains the pirates.
Several ships are Imperial, too. The Empire doesn't want the pirates or us getting to them.
Were there valuables aboard when they went down?
Anything worth salvaging?
That's putting it mildly.
One of the crashed vessels contains a full technical readout of the Emperor's fortress.
A map of the bad guy's house. Nice.
One of the Empire's top scientists during the war upgraded the fortress's defenses. He was the only non-Sith to ever see the inside.
The technical readouts were lost when the scientist crashed here. His shipwreck has never been found.
We're not going to just dig in the snow and hope for the best, are we?
I hope you have a lead on it.
No. Your job is to clear the way once I know where we're going.
That's a surprising amount of top secret information.
How do we know all this?
Republic SIS raided an Imperial Intelligence base on Nar Shaddaa. This information was among dozens of classified data files they recovered.
I doubt those technical readouts survived. This is a waste of time.
They were probably destroyed.
You'd be amazed what's still intact. There's a good reason everyone's coming to Hoth.
Those technical readouts are critical to infiltrating the Emperor's fortress. We will not fail.
T7 = polished + charged + ready!
I'm headed for the main Republic base. Take a shuttle to the surface and meet me there. Leeha Narezz out....
Your assistance is welcome, but please keep our mission's details to yourself.
Hit the heavy cannons, Sergeant. Move!
Destroy those turrets, Rusk.
Enough of this! Kill everyone!
Leave the turrets to me, Rusk. Open fire!
Target the soldiers, Sergeant.
Better late than never, Sergeant Rusk.
Glad you made it.
The Force is with us.
The Force is with us.
Show some concern for me.
Show some concern for me.
